com.foodbook.foodbook
Class FridgeActivity

java.lang.Object
  Activity
      com.foodbook.foodbook.TitleBarOverride
          com.foodbook.foodbook.FridgeActivity

public class FridgeActivity
extends TitleBarOverride

This class is an activity class for Ingredients.

Once a User has created an ingredient, it is displayed.

The User has the option to :

  • Add an ingredient
  • Edit an ingredient
  • Remove an ingredient
  • Search for recipes based on ingredients

Author:
Jaeseo Park (jaeseo1), Jasmine Woo (jwoo), Nhu Bui (nbui), Robert Janes (rjanes)
See Also:

showInputDialog

private void showInputDialog(boolean add,
                             java.lang.String defaultString,
                             int position)
Create an alert dialog to handle ingredient modification

Parameters:
add - User wants to add an ingredient
defaultString - if the user does not add text to an ingredient a blank string is assigned
position - element at which the ingredient is added
See Also:
AlertDialog

showOptionDialog

private void showOptionDialog(int position)
Alert dialog created to show the options of an ingredient. The user is able to "Edit" or "Delete" an ingredient

Parameters:
position - element at which the selected ingredient is located
See Also:
AlertDialog

showInValidInputMessage

public void showInValidInputMessage()
A toast to handle the event of an invalid input. If a User enters no text, the toast is displayed.

See Also:
Toast

updateListView

private void updateListView(Fridge myFridgeToBeDisplayed,
                            ListView listView)
A view in the MVC architecture. Handles displaying of ingredients to screen

Parameters:
myFridgeToBeDisplayed - Fridge object being displayed
listView - Space in which ingredients are listed
